intro: Siphonoglossa canbyi, commonly known as the canby's siphonoglossa, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Siphonoglossa canbyi is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
